thread.title: Arsenal news: Stats reveal where it's gone wrong for the Gunners | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Stats reveal where it's gone wrong for the Gunners | Metro News

author: Mark Brus For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Stats reveal where it's gone wrong for the Gunners | Metro News
text:
Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 7 Feb 2017 11:38 am Mesut Ozil is often accused of not doing the dirty work (Picture: Getty) 
It may seem harsh to call Arsenal lazy – quite often they’re simply under-confident, ill-disciplined, ravaged by injuries or simply down right unlucky – but stats suggest their recent slump can be put down to little more than a lack of putting in the hard yards. Former Chelsea man picks just three current stars in Ancelotti/Conte combined XI 
Incredibly, the Gunners have been out-run by their opponents in each of their last nine Premier League games, stretching all the way back to mid-December. 
Arsenal’s title dream is surely over for the season after back-to-back defeats against Watford and Chelsea, and the players must take a sizeable chunk of the blame for not putting in enough effort at such a crucial point of the campaign. Arsenal being outrun in their games plus Wenger's unwanted record pic.twitter.com/xQI4ZVv1nY 
— ALEX KAY-JELSKI (@AlexKJTimes) February 7, 2017 
Arsene Wenger’s side have won just four games in this nine-match run, with their lack of running costing them dear in some disappointing slip-ups against Everton, Bournemouth and Watford in particular. 
While Arsenal are often undone by the better sides, there is no excuse for being bettered by teams of that calibre because some players aren’t doing their share of the work.
